summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney to defense counsel in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, proposing to confer about setting a trial date between September and December 2021. It is a procedural scheduling communication.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Appears as a recipient of the email, presumably counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Appears as a recipient of the email, presumably counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)).

connections.description: Menninger is listed as counsel in the case against Maxwell, indicating a legal defense relationship.
Pagliuca is listed as counsel in the case against Maxwell, indicating a legal defense relationship.
Both are listed as counsel for the defendant, indicating they are co-counsel or part of the same defense team.

events.title: Proposed Trial Date Window
events.description: The prosecution proposes conferring to set a trial date within this period for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is a scheduling email from the prosecution to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case.
It seeks to set a trial date between September and December 2021.
The case is identified as United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN).
Laura Menninger and Jeff Pagliuca are identified as defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell.
The correspondence originates from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York.
